newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH YR/YR SEPT CPI AT 18.9 PCT - FIN MINISTER.
newsitem.headline: POLISH YR/YR SEPT CPI AT 18.9 PCT - FIN MINISTER.

text.p: Polish year-on-year inflation in September is estimated at 18.9 percent, down from 20.5 percent in August, Finance Minister Grzegorz Kolodko said on Friday.
"According to my preliminary estimates inflation in September was 18.9 percent (year-on-year)," Kolodko told a news conference.
On Thursday the central bank deputy head Witold Kozinski also said September year-on-year inflation should not exceed 19 percent.

The official inflation target for the whole of 1996 as envisaged by this year's budget is 17 percent and the central bank has said Poland stood a good chance of reducing inflation to below 18 percent from 21.6 percent in 1995.
The Central Statistical Office (GUS) is due to release the official consumer price index figures for last month on October 15.
